form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Tillis (for himself, Mr. Budd, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Daines, and Mr. Lankford) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend title XI of the Social Security Act to equalize the negotiation period between small-molecule and biologic candidates under the Drug Price Negotiation Program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ensuring Pathways to Innovative Cures Act of 2025 or the EPIC Act of 2025.

section.header: Equalizing the negotiation period between small-molecule and biologic candidates under the Drug Price Negotiation Program
section.text: Section 1192(e)(1)(A)(ii) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320f–1(e)(1)(A)(ii)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking year, at least 7 and inserting “year—

subclause.text: for initial price applicability years 2026 and 2027, at least 7

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: for initial price applicability year 2028 and each subsequent initial price applicability year, at least 11 years will have elapsed since the date of such approval; and
